outcome: Branch A: The Automated Mourning. Three days after Halden's death, the BCI launches a mandatory 'reflection period.' Those failing to submit digital condolences face automatic score reductions. Public confusion and political maneuvering erupt, exposing factional divides as old scandals resurface.

events.description: BCI pushes mandatory condolence submissions citywide to honor Halden, linking compliance scores to participation. Confusion erupts as many receive unclear or repeated prompts.
A surge of complaints about unfair score drops triggers rushed Council meetings. The Directorate accuses the Innovators of exploiting the event to add controversial behavior tracking updates.
A Directorate review traces the condolence initiative to old BCI pilot code repurposed without oversight. Hints of previous psychiatric incident coverups resurface in internal Council debates.
A faction of residents quietly refuse to participate, rapidly dropping into the monitored compliance tier. Social media fills with stories of automated warnings and sudden loss of city privileges.
